info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:01PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Otero County through 330 PM MDT... At 259 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Timberon, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orogrande and The Otero Mesa. This includes Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 29 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
